question: Which organisation has won the 2015 Indira Gandhi Peace Prize?
option1: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)
answer: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)
explanation: Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh has presented the 2015 Indira Gandhi Prize for Peace, Disarmament and Development to the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) at a function in New Delhi on May 18, 2017. Apart from this, the 2014 Indira Gandhi Peace Prize has been given to Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) for historic Mars Orbiter Mission (MOM), which was received by the ISRO chairman Kiran Kumar on behalf of the space body. The award consists of a trophy, a cash prize of Rs 1 crore and a citation.  The award
